description:
The Building Healthy Minds in Nature (BHMIN) or Healthy Tomorrows Project is a collaboration between community parks, public health, nature experts, and physicians with the goal of empowering youth in South and East LA County to lead healthy lives. The Department of Medicine is looking to hire a motivated student who will get hands-on experience in facilitating a health program while being exposed to careers in public health, non-profits, and academia. In this role, you will provide clerical and administrative support to the project. Work will include data entry, paperwork completion, converting files, scanning and copying documents, and assisting with projects as needed.

Hourly range: $17.30-$25.00
